author: {'steamid': '76561197984935784', 'num_games_owned': 2236, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1672993118}
review:
Редко захожу писать отрицательные отзывы, но тут тот самый случай. Игра продается как Stronghold, но больше напоминает нелюбимых многими Settlers 5, даже карты и дизайн строений схожи, разве что сюжета почти не завезли и героев нет (или я до них не дошел). 

Мрачный средневековый антураж и вся экономика направленная на военное дело и оборону - само по себе не плохо, но это просто не работает.

- Строительство стен настолько неприятное и неудобное, насколько вообще возможно;
- Выделение крестьян кликом происходит не там, где стоит крестьянин. Кстати свободных рабочих придется искать с  лупой, и вообще вспомнить куда вы посылали их.
- ИИ максимально не послушный и тупой. Войска бегут по одним им известным траекториям, а рабочие могут буквально ОТКАЗАТЬСЯ идти строить то, что вы скажете.
И это, буквально, только начало игры!

Спасибо, конечно, я лучше что-нибудь качественное включу. Даже Settlers 5 не вызывал столько неприятных эмоций.

review:
O jogo em si é bem interessante. 
Pra quem gosta de jogos de RTS não sente tanta dificuldade com a mecânica do jogo que, no pouco que joguei, achei parecido com o Stronghold da Firefly, mas é claro, com suas diferenças e singularidades. 

Porém, o maior problema do jogo é que realmente ele foi abandonado pela desenvolvedora. O jogo está cheio de bugs. E o que me levou a escrever esta analise foi que eu não consegui jogar por 10 minutos uma partida da campanha sem que o jogo fechasse sozinho. Tentei, para dar continuidade a campanha e não perder o progresso, ir salvando o jogo a cada novo detalhe que eu fazia na partida, contudo, ainda assim, o jogo continua fechando, o que torna muito difícil concluir uma simples campanha. 

Se a distribuidora cuidasse do seu jogo, e corrigisse os erros, e claro acrescentasse alguns detalhes, não tenho duvidas que seria um ótimo jogo.

review: A slow moving RTS that encourages digging in.   It is fun but the walls will often not want to attach to your towers.  Then you have to leave a hole, which is unacceptable, or build another tower between and hope it works next time.  This can force you to making arcing walls that you just wanted to have straight, pulling your walls away from your defenses.  A game based on building walls shouldn't have this issue.  Worse than that is the fact that the game crashes for me.  Usually after playing a mission for about an hour.  Hard to play a game that can scew you at any moment and force you to restart the mission.  Not restarting the mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040794088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1496662331}
review:
Honestly, most of the reviews are negative. But in my opinion the game is really good even with its cons.
This game is definently comparable to Lord of the Rings Battle for Middle Earth 2.
The gameplay is mostly the same, but you can control each warrior, you have more choise in building, more ressources to gather, etc.

There are obviously some cons if there are mostly negative reviews. 
- Typically, I have a GTX 980 + i7 4790 and i run it at 90-100 FPS, which is not so good for an RTS with medium typed graphics quality. (The graphics are like in LOTR BFMO2).
- Second point, is that building walls is very specific, and you will need some time to understand how it is to be placed.
- The worst part I have found in the game, is that selecting units by holding the right click is problematic.

And thats it. Honestly, I don't know how people could write a negative review about this game. Of course the game has to be a bit more polished, but overall it IS GOOD.
If you are an RTS fan, but it for maybe 10$, or wait sales, because I would even buy it for 20.

UPD : - The AI is stupid, there is no skirmish, and no voice acting in campaign.

I don't normally write reviews but I felt that others should be warrned. Please do not waste your time or money on this game, even if it on sale or free. Just save your self the frustration, because I know If I had read this review before buying, I would be $40 richer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039092841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1461507681}
review:
Lo compre por 5€ y no recomiendo el juego.

1-El juego se cuelga cada dos por tres aun bajando la calidad de imagen al minimo; que no deberia hacerlo. Mi ordenador aguanta juegos con calidad de video bastante superior. No entiendo como da tanto problema. 
2-El control de las unidades es bastante pesimo. No hay forma de redigirlas o redireccionarlas. Las unidades no forman grupos y se mezclan. 
3-Las unidades a pie destrullen demasiado rapido las murallas. Las catapultas y demás maquinaria de asedio tiene el mismo rango de longitud que las colocadas en las defensas de las torres.
4-Las unidades se crean muy despacio. No da tiempo a reponer soldados cuando éstos mueren, aun convirtiendo a todos los aldeanos en guerreros.
5-Los aldeanos son un poco inutiles. Cuando seleccionas a varios para que construyan parte de la muralla, algunos se colocan en el lado opuesto. Si en el otro lado hay roca o un barranco se quedan atrapados. No hay forma de indicarles que construyan desde el otro lado. Lo hacen automaticamente. Esto te hace perder el tiempo levantando y destruyendo la muralla. 
6-A este juego, como a muchos, le falta un editor de mapas. Me gustaria poder crear mi mapa y colocar las montañas y los recursos donde yo quiera. Encima que tardan en crearse las unidades, ir a buscar minerales es una odisea.

En resumen, es un juego que por la calidad de video que se ve en las imagenes pintaba bastante bien.(((MENTIRA))) Podria ser un buen juego. El poder hacer tu propia ciudad fortificada, colocar los edificios donde quieras y con la orientacion que quieras... todo eso esta muy bien, pero el juego funciona muy lento, los aldeanos recogen recursos muy lentamente y crear soldados cuando te atacan tambien es lento, además de que el combate es bastante caotico. El juego da muchos problemas. 


¡NO LO COMPREIS!

review:
Edit: Dec 2022

On sale for a 1.49...It's not much, still not worth it. As I say below, there is a good concept here...putting aside the "jank" and not being able to build walls properly for a stronghold/castle.. The real problem is, after first few battle maps you play, some don't load right and there is no way to finish them. The later you get in the game, the more common this happens, I think it was the only 5th or 6th mission the objective wasn't on the map. Probably most of my hours were on that one mission. 

The finished product feels basically like the first version of a beta that wasn't even attempted to be fixed.

The worst thing is, most people who like this genera will get the concept and enjoy it, but can't enjoy because it's impossible. That's the frustrating part. It could have been a good solid game.


GREAT CONCEPT! There is a lot of different units in just one class of solider, in most games of this nature you might just have crossbow men and archers, you have other type of bow men and other combat units that are good for ceartin type of attacks, so your not always just tossing out top tier troops

Besides that, the game falls flat and is simply broken. Yes the dreaded broken game my friends. I played and played level 3 a several times, and can't beat it because the game doesn't want me to, it's not due to lack of trying or being defeated....It just  freezes on the level after a half hour or so.

In any game, buidling your castle is one of the most fun parts, it's a freak'en nightmare. Nothing lines up, even when you think your walls are together they aren't, for some odd reason. When you finally do get your castle walls straight it seems like you only need a handful of bowmen to fend off any baddies. 

The AI took the short bus to school,  they charge your castle in small groups sort of like they are hazing you and testing you out but they end up accomplishing nothing.

It does have an interesting system  when it comes to getting resources, you just don't chop down word, you have to make them into planks with a special production house. I like the mirco mangement, and you can switch workers from job to job. I like RTS games where it takes time to raise an army and it's not just about who can build the fastest army first like starcraft. 

I would have finished the game dispite it's flaws but at the end of the day when a game is broken and can't play you can't give it a thumbs up.

review:
Ich habe Citadels während einer Rabattaktion gekauft. Das PC Spiel ist von einem auf dem Markt, unbekannten Entwicklerteam und allgemein akzeptabel. Ich persönlich finde es nicht gut, das es nur 1 Scharmützelkarte gibt und der Cursor flackert. Ein Editor (Zufallskarten) mit mehr Möglichkeiten ist unbedingt notwendig: Kontinente (Hafen!), Inseln, Halbinseln, Mittelmeer, Flüsse, Hügel und Berge. Auch die Rohstoffverteilung, wie Holz, Stein und Erz müsste in einem Editor einzustellen möglich sein. Es wird auch Getreide gebraucht und alle Rohstoffe müssen in Betrieben und Werkstätten, weiterverarbeitet werden. Gebäudeupgrades sind möglich und die Bogenschützen, Schwertkämpfer, Ritter und Belagerungsmaschinen können aufgewertet werden.
Wer zu Age of Empires 3 greift oder zu Die Siedler 7, hat Perfektion gewählt.

review:
A famosa BitCompuser, nos leva a viajar num passado fantástico nesta nova versão da saga do Rei Arthur.

O jogo segue os moldes de "Age of Empire", tendo ainda outros modos de jogo para se deleitar. Seguindo o modo Campanha, o Rei Arthur está governando. Ele é um grande e sábio governador. Seus súditos o tratam com respeito e os Cavaleiros da Távola Redonda permanecem fielmente ao seu lado. Está é Camelot! Os arqui-inimigos de Arthur reuniram forças com os Saxões e os Nórdicos para formar um imenso exército. E Arthur fará de tudo para não ver seu sonho destruído.

Gráficos, jogabilidade, dificuldade das campanhas e outros pequenos pontos..., são excelentes! Suas decisões e estratégias, podem mudar a história..., e o rumo do Jogo, traduzindo-se me grandes batalhas. É uma grande aquisição em sua bibliioteca, garantia de várias horas de entreterimento. Minha única crítica... está diante do fato, que todo o jogo está "amarrado" no modo Campanha... impedindo a criação de cenários aleatórios, e somente desafios de batalha.

Mas, como não podia deixar de ser... este jogo, eu também, RECOMENDO!!

review:
So this game had the potential to be great, but everything they tried to do was simply implemented horribly. I tried to see the positives in this game to no avail. My rant/review shall now commence.

You'd imagine that the wall and citadel construction would have been done right since it's the bloody title of the game.. well guess again, it's horrendous and inexplicably complicated and bugy. (also for some reason, the further away you place your wall, the less fps you have, I don't understand how that could be an actual correlation in this day and age)

Another thing is the menus and extremely unfriendly interface. There are many icons which supposedly show different resources.. the only thing is they're basically all the same. Adding to the horrible interface is the crappy layout of buildings and options. There's just a bunch of fancy pop-out menus with NOTHING in them. You will literally see a huge menu with only one option and no tooltips or anything. Oh and remember all those lovely hotkeys that every relatively new rts has? That's right you guessed it, this game has none.

As I'm sure you've noticed, this is quite an angry review and has turned into a rant rather than an objective review. BUT, after having played a few skirmishes against the so called 'a.i.' I felt compelled to try and save you from the dreadful experience that lies ahead.

I somehow managed to get it for 6 euros and I still feel cheated. This game is so pre-alpha that no one should ever be able to buy it until they at least remove all the bugs and arrange the ai and interface.

Save yourself and your wallet, do not waste money on this.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

I'm out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978618078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1408410299}
review:
Citadels has potential but it isn't worthy it's current cost.  There are many older castle/siege games available on the market that are better in content and gameplay.  Citadels gameplay was okay.  My main complaints were the ackwardness of some building upgrades and the low population cap.  Considering the amount of population required to maintain your economy, a cap of 99 people was maddening when trying to manage an army.  At first I assumed the population limit would increase as the campaign progressed but before I knew it the campaign was over and the cap never changed.  I played a couple skirmish/sandbox games.  The castle defense one was boring on normal difficulty.  I then tried a duel map and found it more fun.  Both maps had ackward terrain to build on.  Steep terrain is a pain to build walls on.  It usually requires building towers close together.  However, if you build towers to close together, you may be prevented from building walls between them too.
Overall, the game wasn't very fun to play and recommend playing other games out there.

review:
I do not usually write reviews, but I felt the need to warn people about this game. This is a fun concept if you enjoy strategy games or like whole castle/fortess theme. The problem is the game is designed as though the last 10 years of game developement never happened. There are no tool tips for the majority of the interfaces. You are left to guess what upgrades actually do. There are three game types in skirmish mode, but you are not told any of the information until you launch them. The settings section has you clicking through options one at a time instead of having a drop down menu. The game has a 99 population limit, which would make sense if it was a game with a lot of micro managing of individual units - it is not. Most of the challenge in the game is figuring out how to deal with the tiny population limits and figuring out how to get a wall that is glitched built before the next attack. 

Essentially if this game came out in 2004 it would have been amazing, but it plays like a game from then with some updated graphics and plenty of bugs with walls and structures. I do not recommend it. I feel sorry for the people that worked really hard on this, because it just didn't come together.

Wish I could call this a decent game, first 30 minutes were good fun. HOWEVER the nightmare started after when it crashed constantly like no other game that I have previously played, and I run pretty high spec games on my pc, and this one is by far not one of them. 
Compared to other games of the same genre I would say it ranks around 30/100, due to how much it crashes I found myself loosing a lot of things done because I didn't save every freaking minute. 
There is no auto save option and no short key for saving either, which makes it pretty easy to forget to save when you're in the middle of building a decent city and a powerful army. 
I had to leave the game several times before having to reattempt a mission because I forgot to save and it just decided to crash on me, so trust me it can lead you to a rage quit :/
Building and Unit quality/content is quite poor, there is very little to do and explore.
The AI is completly retarded, they cannot carry out simple tasks like cutting a tree which you tell them to, instead they go off and cut down another tree miles away from where you told them to go.
The AI will very commonly forget where the resources are located despite their assigned work place being right next to it... In other words the AI behaves like a 3 year old for most of the time, which is my opinion is appaling for a game of this price.
The graphics aren't amazing, however in a strategy game I consider that to be the least important thing and having played strategy games for over 10 years I can still have fun in a game that reminds me of old experiences through its graphics.
Personally I really didn't like it, I really don't think it is worth £30 when it lacks so much and the quality is really not the best, many other games of the kind would be a better option if you're interested...
All in all, quite disapointed, as having payed full price I had really high hopes for it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025659138', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1395351122}
review:
I bought this game on a whim, since it was only $10 at the time. I was expecting a clone of the Stronghold series, with perhaps some embelishments or improvements. This game provides neither. In fact, it can't even provide the basic expectations of an RTS game. After playing it for about an hour I was surprised to see this wasn't an 'Early Access' game, but instead claims to be 'complete.'  The game most lacks in its user interface (UI), which if improved, would bring it at least on par to other RTSes.

Areas for improvement: 
1. Double-clicking a control group (0-9) doesn't center on units. And there is no additional key to do so. This is unforgivable.
2. The game helpfully informs you that you are under attack. Hope you noticed that one minimap ping, because otherwise you're clicking through controls groups trying to find the one taking damage, and then remembering where that group is (see 1 above). There needs to be a 'zoom to last alert' key or equivalent. 
3. Speaking of minimap. When you have a unit selected, the unit info covers half of the minimap. You can hide the minimap, and the unit info. But maybe they should just make the unit info smaller... Or make the minimap movable?
4. Trees block building. And I didn't find a way to manually dfestroy a tree. I looked in the keybinds, and found what can be best called a 'minimalist' interface. You have WASD camera controls (not my cup of tea for an RTS, but whatever), control groups (0-9), and then a couple keys for peasant (resource gatherer) management. No attack-move, manual attack, zoom-to-unit, etc.

This game might have potential, if like I said, it was not billed as complete. There's much more I would want, but those listed I think are some bare-minimums needed to make it playable.  To be honest, I haven't played long, but I found myself fighting the game controls and 'lost' for most of it. Pick up Stronghold to fill your midievil RTS needs.

review:
Même s'il tend à rappeler un bon vieux Stronghold et à permettre de construire son propre château tel qu'on l'a voulu, Citadels souffre de gros problèmes. Non, ce ne sont pas les graphismes un peu dépassés, qui sont, pour moi, assez secondaires et bien assez beaux, bien conçus. Non, le jeu souffre de deux problèmes majeurs :
1. Le son des ouvriers au travail devient vite accablant, j'avais l'impression d'être en usine tant ça m'abrutissait, et j'imagine qu'un paquet de joueurs va vite couper le son juste pour ne plus entendre les bûcherons.
2. Des crashs réguliers, même avec des réglages assez bas, un jeu très instable donc, prompt à freeze & crash régulièrement.
Ajoutez à cela une tendance du terrain à se mettre en travers de vos murailles et à gâcher vos plans pour quelques pixels mal placés, et vous aurez vite fait de n'en plus pouvoir. Sans compter qu'à chaque fois, une bonne muraille devant connecter deux tours, ça vous oblige à démonter/remonter une tour au moins à chaque coup ; et à subir à nouveau le bruit des marteaux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996583431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1538598980}
review:
I see a ton of bad reviews for this, had to even click "see positive" to see any of those.  I wish i didn't have to pick whether or not i would recommend it, and i'll tell you why.  

When i saw this come rolling in, i guess i took the description the wrong way, as i assumed it would be more of a base-builder/town managment deal.  The kind where you focus more on building walls and planning your town than training troops and sending them to attack other groups on the map.  

Unfortunately, i was wrong, this plays like a plethora of other RTS games, all already established with their fans.  Much like the Age of Empires 2 HD i bought sometime back around the november-december sales.  You cna build walls and turrets, but the focus was more on just holding your base until you'd trained troops to go attack other bases.  I can't recommend it because this wasn't even what i was looking for, nor is it any better than other RTS games already available new or old.

It's not a bad game, some collision detection with your own units acts weird and the cursor doesn't seem to like being where it is at times, but it's nothing that won't likely be patched up by the time it's at an actual release version.  If you like these kinds of games and want something slightly different feeling but still familiar, sure try it out, but it's no better than what you probably already have.

tl;dr, not too bad, not too good, disappointly average.  Wasn't what i thought it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978035874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1388915640}
review:
I don't recommend this game because although it's an RTS war game, there are still glitches where your workers just stand around after giving them commands, they're hard to click because you can't even pinpoint where you are trying to click.

I click my worker, and it does not select him...i have to move the mouse about nearly an inch away from where i want to click for it to click the target, which made it extremely hard for me to click things and build my base, not to mention it takes about 45 minutes at least to establish enough of a base to start fighting. Thats too long for an RTS to build a base in my opinion.

I play warcraft 3, starcraft 2, age of empires, max it takes is 15-20 minutes to build a base and normally you already have units to fight by then as well....where as in citadels, it takes nearly 45 minutes to an hour to get there.

Other negative things i've found:
-Everytime you have a worker build something, no matter where it is, or what it is...one of them have to go all the way back to the town hall to get a sack of supplies, now if you build a decent size base, like most RTS players do, you end up waiting 30+ seconds for your worker to run there and back to the building you ordered them to build, which is really stupid in my opinion, it's suppose to be a real time strategy, not a peace treaty of 45+ minutes to build a base and an army of 149 (cap).

-Also, i noticed there seems to only be one map you can play skirmish on...big down fall.

-There are no playable customization/Races of any kind. Like warcraft 3 had Orcs, Humans, Night elf, and undead....where as this game has nothing but the same exact units for both you and your enemy. Very disappointing to me as an RTS player.

-The workers sometimes just stop building your buildings, i had one worker build me a moat, and i came back to see how it looks, and he just decided to never build it and stand there. What good are the workers if they don't work?

-For experienced RTS users like myself, we like to use hotkeys to build and command things, it makes it quicker and more efficient for us....there are NO hot keys in this game. You have to manually click each building you want, and wait.

-Very disappointed i spent money on this game....even after they supposely did a lot of updates...

1/5/2014 review

review:
Практически удобоваримая RTS.

Игра звезд с неба не хватает (я тут решил не медлить и сказать, что не такое уж и говно, даже играть интересно, просто не очень удобно...совсем не удобно). Начну с сюжета - жил был король Артур...бла-бла...потом (как всегда) все умерли (и король помер, пал среди первых), но рыцари круглого стола выжили (в значительно меньшем составе) и решили всех спасти. В принципе это весь сюжет, такие дела. И сразу к графике, я прекрасно понимаю, что для стратегии это не главное, но всё же, можно хоть немного блюра какого-нибудь или там текстур почетче. Геймплей стандартен - добываем ресурсы, строимся, нанимаем войска (переобучаем крестьян) и мочим врага. Ага, вот тут-то и подвох - хрен вам, а не спокойные нервы, игра очень неудобна во всех аспектах. Изволите строить - вам будут нужны способности ясновидения, ибо простая логика не срабатывает (блджад, почему камень добывают в яме, а не в каменоломне???). Ни каких подписей и подсказок, только намеки и недомолвки. Не знаю даже, но наверное, поиграть все же стоит, ну или хотя бы попробовать, очень спорно.

Догони катапульту! 5,5 из 10 :)

review:
Patch Update: Patch 4.0.4 has really done wonders. Villager AI is much improved. The cap for skirmish maps is now 499 (unfortunately, still just the one map :( ), Units make much more "order recieved" noise (however it does seem to be location based, if you don't have your screen near your units you still don't hear anything) and it seems most of the outstanding bugs have been squashed.   

At 75% off this game is a steal.

Patch Update: As of patch 3.9.2 the game has really begun to take a good form. You can increase the unit count in Skirmish maps (max was 99, now is 149), the campaign (which is almost bug free as far as completion goes) is easy enough with the current 99 cap imo. The tooltips in both the UI and unit feedback is much improved. You can finally set your hotkeys to what you want. (units are still a bit too silent for my liking, not gamebreaking though) There are still some things that aren't explained fully during gameplay, (the upgrade button comes to mind) but most of those are easy enough to figure out on your own.

The graphics, combat, and physics are cleaner/smoother making for a much better experience. And there are more updates on the way.

Not to say its bug free yet. But this game is getting much improved as the patches go along. If you haven't looked at this game for a while, I would urge you to do so, you just might be suprised.

Now if they would add more skirmish maps!....Or randomise them.

Original Review:
To start, yes, there are bugs, (Booo....UI can be a hard one to get a hold of, and tooltips aren't really tippy...) but so far nothing game breaking (knock on wood). But I am amazed on how the game works. 

Building is phenominal. 

Gather the resource, and once the resource building is full, bring it to your town center. 

Want to build a building? The builder needs to grab the materials, then go to the build site. 

Don't like the building there? Can't hit delete. You need to deconstruct buildings, which takes time, so place carefully. 

Walls are finally a laborious task to build, no more destroy a wall and build it 2 seconds later.

Train your units? Tell them to go to the training center, not just pop out of thin air.

Want better stuff? Refine your mats.

My only beef is how moats work (almost pointless) and walls, to be effective, need to be ended with a tower, and gates can only be placed on towers (but i guess when you see how they are built, its understandable)

The combat is a bit iffy, so if your looking for a deep combat game like the early strongholds, its not quite that refined, but its still a blast.

Given the game isn't MP at all, and it still has some wrinkles to iron out, it may not be worth 40 to most people, but if your able to get it on sale (got mine for 32 at GMG and couldn't be happier) please go for it. This is one of those games that has gotten much better because of patches. It's just a shame that critic reviews and most gamer reviews won't account for it.

review:
Have you been looking for a new real time strategy game lately to scratch that strategy itch you've been having? Well look elsewhere, because Citadels is a dreadful and incomplete mess. The game was created by an unknown and inexperienced development studio called Games Distillery. Currently a different studio called Big Moon was hired to add further playability and stability to the game. In the future, at best you can only hope for a polished yet dreadful entertainment product (without the entertainment value). 

Citadels attempts to accomplish what so many other strategy games have already done before, and it accomplishes those things poorly. Citadels most closely resembles a stripped down Age of Empires title. Everything from base building, combat, and resource gathering are implemented poorly. There is no strategy involved at all because combat boils down to spamming units. You can literally spam the most basic miliary unit available and win every time. The utter lack of military units available leaves no room for strategy, tactics, or planning at all. 

The game has a boring campaign that currently can't even be finished entirely, and a few lacklusted skirmish modes with terrible AI. There is only one map available per skirmish mode and no matter the difficulty you choose you cannot lose due to the incompetent AI. Citadels is only a singleplayer game so these are your only options. There is no map or scenario editor or multiplayer of any kind. The poor quality of this title combined with the utterlack of content at a $40 price point is downright theivery. Avoid at all costs.

I only put 3 hours into this game but that was rather generous of me. The boring gameplay, poor design, and lack of content leave little reason for me to play any further.

review:
フルプライスの価値は無い、悲しいけど現実

StrongHoldに近いDeffenciveメインなRTSゲーム
資源回収→建造→防衛or攻撃のプロセスで相手の陣地を破壊すれば勝利

良い点を挙げたい所であるが欠点が目立ちすぎるのが悲しい所
バグ修正で急いでゲームを完成品にすると開発元は言ってはいるが如何せんこの値段なのが酷い
20-30ドルのプライス帯のゲームならそこまで言わないのだが+10でXCOM：EnemyTerritoryが買えた事を考えると怒りたくもなる
同価格以下ならAoE2や3も買えるしRTSとして39ドルと言う価値を為していない

欠点ばかり挙げ連なっているが致命的な点として下記を挙げる
1.ホットキーの設定不可
RTSとして致命的
そしてホットキーが何に対応しているかがマウスオーバーでも見る事が出来ない
マニュアルにもゲーム内オプションにも明らかに少なすぎるホットキーの記載

2.シングル専門にしてはお粗末過ぎるAI
農民をいきなり開幕から陣地に送り込んできてハラスをしてくる
更に殴られてる農民はデフォルトの設定なら反撃をしないのでAIのやってくる農民ハラスの鬱陶しさ
かと言って攻撃モードにしたらしたで農民がハラス対応にかまけだすので内政が完全に止まる本末転倒具合
弓兵を数人置くだけで何故か相手が運んでる資源まで落としだすのでAIの設定が明らかにおかしいと言わざるを得ない
しかも農民ハラスに弓兵で対抗しているとカタパルト等、攻城兵器を持ち出してくるが防衛が農民なので・・・以下略である

3.RTSとしてはお粗末過ぎるミニマップと建造位置の把握のし辛さ
一番の不満
資源表示も分かりにくいため何処に何があるのか把握が難しい上、上記の農民ハラスによる面倒さでイライラする仕様
更に攻撃をされた場合「Under attack」と表示される割にミニマップで攻撃されたポイントが把握し辛いため（効果音もほとんどならない）
至る所に弓兵を置く羽目になるが上記の仕様のためすり抜けたりすると内政地帯がてんやわんやになっていたりする
そのため壁と塔を配置しようとすると建造地点が非常に分かりづらいため弓兵を配置した方が早かったりする
塔だけ建ててカタパルトとバリスタ置いておくのが一番マシ

4.テンポが悪すぎる
一番致命的なポイント
StrongHoldは一戦に時間がかかると言えど、散発的な戦闘や内政などは迅速な対応を求められるゲームであった
尚且つ、そこに対応出来る良UIであり、センスやミニマップの出来も非常に良かった
更には速度も可変出来たので長い内政などは速度を最高速にしたりで迅速なゲーム展開も可能では有った
がこのゲームではそういったことは不可能である
StrongHoldが退化した中でPVを見る限りStrongHoldオマージュとして非常に良い出来なのかと思っただけに悲しみを覚える

総括すると39ドルもこの出来で取ろうとしたBitGamesに拍手を送りたい
PVみたいな派手な戦闘や防衛はキャンペーンだけだ安心しろ
